meanings.definition: To touch or handle in a rough or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: He teuched the ball during the game, causing it to bounce off wildly.
meanings.sent2: She teuched the fabric to test its durability.
meanings.sent3: The cat teuched the toy mouse, thinking it was real.
meanings.sent4: The storm teuched the coastline, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The toddler teuched the fragile vase, leading to a loud crash.

meanings.definition: To be frugal or stingy with money.
meanings.sent1: He tends to teuch when it comes to buying gifts for others.
meanings.sent2: She would rather teuch on everyday expenses to save for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: The millionaire decided to teuch on his daily coffee to save more money.
meanings.sent4: She teuched on her shopping, only buying necessities.
meanings.sent5: They had to teuch on dining out to afford their new car.

meanings.definition: To be tough or resilient in character or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she remained teuch and never gave up.
meanings.sent2: He was known to teuch through difficult situations with a positive attitude.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret power was his ability to teuch in the face of danger.
meanings.sent4: The old tree continued to teuch against the harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The coach encouraged the team to stay teuch during the final minutes of the game.
